value.title: Self-driving shuttle company adds seatbelts in order to resume US operations
value.excerpt: French self-driving vehicle company EasyMile will add seatbelts to its shuttles in order to be able to once again carry passengers in the US. EasyMile’s shuttles were suspended by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) in late February after an incident where a passenger fell out of her seat during a sudden stop in Columbus,

value.title: No matter how sophisticated, artificial intelligence systems still need human oversight
value.excerpt: AI and machine learning systems are only as good as the data we feed them. Witness the fallout from the COVID-19 crisis, which threw many AI algorithms out of whack: 'If machines are to be trusted, we need to watch over them.

value.title: UPDATE 1-GM CEO calls self-driving unit layoffs 'prudent,' still sees 'huge opportunity'

value.title: EasyMile Self-Driving Shuttles Add Seatbelts To Get Back In Operation
